Description: model type of the Interbotix LoCoBot such as ``locobot_base`` or ``locobot_wx250s``.
name of the robot (could be anything but defaults to ``locobot``).
the Interbotix Arm model on the LoCoBot; this should never be set manually but rather left to its default value.
launches RViz if set to ``true``.
fixed frame in RViz; this should be changed to ``map`` or ``odom`` if mapping or using local odometry respectively.
if ``true``, the base ROS nodes are launched.
if ``true``, the odom TF from the base will be published. This only works on the CreateÂ® 3 base.
the type of mobile base used by the robot.
if ``true``, the RPLidar node is launched.
if ``true``, the RealSense camera nodes are launched.
enables the RealSense camera's pointcloud.
set the logging level for the realsense2_camera launch include.
set the logging location for the realsense2_camera launch include.
On occasions the RealSense camera is not closed properly and due to firmware issues needs to reset. If set to ``true``, the device will reset prior to usage.
the file path to the 'motor config' YAML file.
``base`` if the robot_model is locobot_base; ``all`` otherwise
the file path to the 'mode config' YAML file.

a boolean that specifies whether or not the initial register values (under the 'motors' heading) in a Motor Config file should be written to the motors; as the values being written are stored in each motor's EEPROM (which means the values are retained even after a power cycle), this can be set to ``false`` after the first time using the robot. Setting to ``false`` also shortens the node startup time by a few seconds and preserves the life of the EEPROM.
set the logging level of the X-Series Driver.
if ``true``, the DYNAMIXEL simulator node is run; use RViz to visualize the robot's motion; if ``false``, the real DYNAMIXEL driver node is run.
tells ROS nodes asking for time to get the Gazebo-published simulation time, published over the ROS topic /clock; this value is automatically set to ``true`` if using Gazebo hardware.
if ``true``, the default gripper is included in the ``robot_description``; if ``false``, it is left out; set to ``false`` if not using the default gripper.
if ``true``, the AR tag mount is included in the ``robot_description``; if ``false``, it is left out; set to ``true`` if using the AR tag mount in your project.
if ``true``, the gripper_bar link is included in the ``robot_description``; if ``false``, the gripper_bar and finger links are not loaded. Set to ``false`` if you have a custom gripper attachment.
if ``true``, the gripper fingers are included in the ``robot_description``; if ``false``, the gripper finger links are not loaded. Set to ``false`` if you have custom gripper fingers.
if ``true``, the lidar is included in the ``robot_description``; only set to ``true`` if you purchased a lidar with your locobot.
the file path to the custom urdf.xacro file that you would like to include in the Interbotix robot's urdf.xacro file.
configures the ``robot_description`` to use the actual hardware, fake hardware, or hardware simulated in Gazebo.
URDF of the robot; this is typically generated by the xacro command.
Default: Command(FindExec\(``xacro``\) + ' ' + LocalVar('FindPackageShare\(pkg= ``interbotix_xslocobot_descriptions``\) + 'urdf' + 'locobot.urdf.xacro'') + ' ' + 'arm_model:=' + LaunchConfig\(``arm_model``\) + ' ' + 'robot_name:=' + LaunchConfig\(``robot_name``\) + ' ' + 'base_model:=' + LaunchConfig\(``base_type``\) + ' ' + 'robot_model:=' + LaunchConfig\(``robot_model``\) + ' ' + 'use_gripper:=' + LaunchConfig\(``use_gripper``\) + ' ' + 'show_ar_tag:=' + LaunchConfig\(``show_ar_tag``\) + ' ' + 'show_gripper_bar:=' + LaunchConfig\(``show_gripper_bar``\) + ' ' + 'show_gripper_fingers:=' + LaunchConfig\(``show_gripper_fingers``\) + ' ' + 'show_lidar:=' + LaunchConfig\(``show_lidar``\) + ' ' + 'external_urdf_loc:=' + LaunchConfig\(``external_urdf_loc``\) + ' ' + 'hardware_type:=' + LaunchConfig\(``hardware_type``\) + ' ')
